node.display_long_description:
New co-op Horde multiplayer mode, supported by regular content and feature updates now available!

Join the fight and experience the ultimate in visceral and immersive futuristic combat.

This all-action shooter arms you with a range of super-powerful weapons and abilities with which to crush your foes. Dive into a gripping, action-filled story spanning the galaxy and battle against the hideous forces of Chaos who threaten the future of humanity

- Explore vast planetary installations, huge derelict space vessels & ancient expansive ruins, in VR for the first time.

- High octane, intense shooter action, face hordes of formidable foes from the dark forces of Chaos.

- Wield 12 incredible and powerful weapons including Chainswords, Plasma Pistols, Boltguns, Flamers, Grenades and Power Swords

- Throw, catch, pass, dodge, free move and dual wield - 

- Massive bosses and epic moments

- Enhanced Quest 2 visuals, dynamic shadows and reflections

latest_supported_binary.change_log:
Patch Notes:

Gameplay:
Multiplayer: Reworked network code for hit detection in MP. Hitting enemies should now be more accurate and natural.
Multiplayer: Each map now has its own music
Multiplayer: Reworked the player area in the Outpost map so that you have more cover points and spaces to move.
Multiplayer/Coop: We added a UI message when your coop buddy dies. 

Bug Fixes:
Rift: We fixed a bug where a user could lose their save games when switching from Quest to Rift
Rift: We fixed a bug that caused the flamer to have no sound effect
Rift/Multiplayer: We fixed a bug that stopped voice chat from using the right audio channel
Multiplayer: We fixed a bug where users did not receive XP if they skipped the animation on the end screen
Multiplayer: We fixed a bug with magazines sometimes floating in the air
Multiplayer: We fixed a bug with the Bolt Pistol when you tried to hold it with two hands
General audio and visual bug fixes

nodes.title: New Update June 25th
nodes.body_text:
Battle Sister Update 1.1.1

A brand new update is here that targets fixes inside Multiplayer and on Rift.

Gameplay:
- Multiplayer: Reworked network code for hit detection in MP. Hitting enemies - should now be more accurate and natural.
- Multiplayer: Each map now has its own music
- Multiplayer: Reworked the player area in the Outpost map so that you have more cover points and spaces to move.
- Multiplayer/Coop: We added a UI message when your coop buddy dies.

Bug Fixes:
- Rift: We fixed a bug where a user could lose their save games when switching from Quest to Rift when loading the game
- Rift: We fixed a bug that caused the flamer to have no sound effect
- Rift/Multiplayer: We fixed a bug that stopped voice chat from using the right audio channel
- Multiplayer: We fixed a bug where users did not receive XP if they skipped the animation on the end screen
- Multiplayer: We fixed a bug with magazines sometimes floating in the air
- Multiplayer: We fixed a bug with the Bolt Pistol when you tried to hold it with two hands
- General audio and visual bug fixes

nodes.title: Skulls Battle Legion Update - New Horde Map & RIFT Release!
nodes.body_text:
A brand new update to Battle Sister is here! We’re excited to announce that this year Battle Sister will be featured inside the Games Workshop Skulls Festival (Formally Skull for the Skull Throne) to celebrate the team here at Pixel Toys have prepared a brand new horde map: Heart of Dread and released Warhammer 40,000: Battle Sister on Rift.

New Horde Map

Heart of Dread takes place inside the deepest, darkest depths of a Chaos space vessel. Battle your way through wave after wave of heretic horde and claim their skulls to upgrade your arsenal of weaponry. This map gives access from all sides of the centre ring, both on ground level, and on the second floor allowing enemies easy access to swarm into the bastion. This map definitely requires some quick thinking and a little bit of good old fashioned teamwork in co-op mode.

Heart of Dread map is our fourth addition to the Last Bastion and available to play right now in both solo and co-op mode!



New Rift Version

We’re also delighted to announce that the Rift version of Battle Sister is now available to play with crossplay and cross-buy enabled. For the uninitiated, this means those who purchase the game on Quest will have access to the Rift version for free and vice versa whilst also being able to play with heroes across both devices.

Our Rift version utilises the power of PC VR to beautifully and masterfully increase texture resolution across all environments, weapons and characters - Immerse yourself deeper into the universe of Warhammer 40,000 with the power of Rift.



What’s next?

We’re keen to hear from the community about where our next update focus should be pointed towards. Join our Discord community by visiting pixeltoys.com/community

node.reviewDescription:
Pros - The weapons look amazing
            The physics are great
            The game is very easy to get used too
            Overall combat is good
            Characters are very cool and easy to connect too
            Reloading feels amazing..it says to reload but bringing the gun to your ammo pouch however grabbing a mag with your hand and putting it in the weapons are amazing 

Cons - Melee isn’t as solid.. Most of the time by melee will not hit or cause damage. 
             Story is very confusing...I’d say this is more opinion based but I could not get a solid understanding of the story.
             Graphics..don’t get me wrong, this game is beautiful looking however some things aren’t.

I have no hate towards this game.

This is a understanding of what I did and didn’t like.
